definitions: Each of the sets of three stumps with two bails across the top at either end of the pitch, defended by a batsman.
The prepared strip of ground between two sets of stumps.
The dismissal of a batsman; each of ten dismissals regarded as marking a division of a side's innings.
A small door or gate, especially one beside or in a larger one.
An opening in a door or wall, often fitted with glass or a grille and used for selling tickets or a similar purpose.
